thread.title: What TV channel for Oregon State Beavers football at Washington State? Start time, how to watch live stream
thread.title_full: What TV channel for Oregon State Beavers football at Washington State? Start time, how to watch live stream | OregonLive.com

author: Joel Odom | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: What TV channel for Oregon State Beavers football at Washington State? Start time, how to watch live stream
text:
It would seem that Washington State would be the heavy favorite Saturday as the Cougars play host to the Oregon State Beavers at Martin Stadium in Pullman.
Yet, things have not necessarily been what they seem this season for Washington State. The same team that lost to FCS Portland State in the season opener hung right with a ranked Cal team, then won at Oregon last week in double overtime.
The Beavers are coming off a drubbing at Arizona, but will Oregon State get it together against WSU? Are the Cougars vulnerable to a fourth consecutive loss to the Beavers in Pullman?
Here's how to watch and follow the game:
What: Oregon State Beavers (2-3, 0-2 Pac-12) at Washington State Cougars (3-2, 1-1)
When: 1 p.m. PDT Saturday (kickoff at 1:07)
Where: Martin Stadium, Pullman. Capacity: 32,952.
TV channel: Pac-12 Network (Comcast 420/720, CenturyLink 687/1687 in Portland area; Dish 409; not available on DirecTV)
Broadcasters: Ted Robinson (play-by-play), Glenn Parker (analyst), Jill Savage (sideline)
Radio: KEX (1190 AM), KEJO (1240 AM); Sirius 137; XM 197
Live stream: Cable and satellite customers who get Pac-12 Networks as part of their subscription can live stream the game via Pac-12 Now online , or through the Pac-12 Now app on their phone or tablet.
Live chat: Check out our live game chat at oregonlive.com/beavers for updates throughout the game.
Latest line: Washington State by 8
Forecast at kickoff: Showers possible, high of 66 degrees
Series history: Washington State leads the all-time series 49-47-3, and the Cougars won 39-32 last season in Corvallis. But the Beavers have won three in a row in Pullman â€” by margins of 32, 23 and 28 points.
